intro: Euploca discordis, commonly known as the discordant euploca, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, often forming dense clusters at the top of the stem. Euploca discordis is relatively uncommon and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
